alert.note: Alert for Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 11:51AM EDT until April 20 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Michigamme River near Witch Lake affecting Marquette and Dickinson Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Sturgeon River near Chassell affecting Baraga and Houghton Counties. Sturgeon River near Alston affecting Baraga and Houghton Counties. South Branch Ontonagon near Ewen affecting Ontonagon County. Michigamme River near Republic affecting Marquette County. Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint) affecting Iron County. Sturgeon River near Nahma Junction affecting Delta County. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint). * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Parking lot of roadside park upstream of M-69 begins to flood * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:10 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 7.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:10 AM CDT Tuesday was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 4.5 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.4 feet on 05/09/1979. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 245 AM CDT /345 AM EDT/.
